main event: Observers noted 4 star-like objects following each other in an irregular formation near Midland, Michigan on October 17, 1966.
interesting points: The objects were larger and brighter than stars,, They changed direction and altitude while moving slowly north,, The sighting lasted approximately 50 minutes,, The objects appeared to be related to the Echo II satellite,, Witnesses described a lack of sound from the objects.
witness description: A 16-year-old male who observed the objects while driving.
